Register function takes three arguments that are functions used in the registration process. Use these functions to register the following components:
`register_xslt_function`: Register Python functions that will be accessed in the XSLT files using the prefix `proteus-utils:`
`register_qwebchannel_class`: Register Python classes that can be accessed from QWebEngineView.
`register_proteus_component`: Register general purpose `Proteuscomponent` classes.
Example of register function: ``` python from remus.document_interactions import DocumentInteractions from remus.glossary_handler import GlossaryHandler from remus.traceability_matrix_helper import TraceabilityMatrixHelper
def register(register_xslt_function, register_qwebchannel_class, register_proteus_component):
# Document Interactions register_qwebchannel_class("documentInteractions", DocumentInteractions)
# Glossary register_xslt_function("glossary_highlight", GlossaryHandler.highlight_glossary_items) register_proteus_component("glossaryHandler", GlossaryHandler)
# Traceability Matrix register_proteus_component("traceabilityMatrixHelper", TraceabilityMatrixHelper) register_xslt_function("get_objects_from_classes", TraceabilityMatrixHelper.get_objects_from_classes) register_xslt_function("check_dependency", TraceabilityMatrixHelper.check_dependency) ```
